Recipes

Adobong Baboy

DESCRIPTION

Adobong Baboy is a popular Filipino dish made with tender pork cooked in a savory and tangy sauce made of soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and black pepper. It is a flavorful and comforting dish that is perfect for any occasion and can be enjoyed with steamed rice.

Beef Kare-Kare

DESCRIPTION

Filipino Beef Kare-Kare is a traditional Filipino stew that is typically made with oxtail, beef tripe or beef shank, along with various vegetables like eggplant, banana blossoms, and string beans. The dish is known for its thick, savory, and slightly sweet peanut sauce which is made with ground peanuts, annatto seeds, and other spices. Kare-Kare is often served with a side of shrimp paste (bagoong) and rice. It is considered a staple dish in many Filipino celebrations and gatherings, and is often enjoyed during special occasions and holidays.

Sinigang

DESCRIPTION

Sinigang is a tamarind-based soup that is known for its sour and savory taste. You can make it with either fish, pork belly, spare ribs or corned beef.

Kinilaw

DESCRIPTION

It hailed from the Visayan region and is derived from the word, kilaw, which means raw or uncooked. The meat, normally a fish, is 'cooked' without the application of heat but is rather cured in vinegar. Additional souring agents like calamansi, kamias, tamarind, or green mangoes to enhance its tartness. To complete the dish, black pepper, onions, ginger, and chili peppers are also added.

Ginataang Manok

DESCRIPTION

Ginataang Manok is translated as chicken stewed in coconut milk. This is a simple Filipino dish wherein chicken is saut√©ed in garlic, onion, and ginger then stewed in coconut milk. A more traditional approach requires native hen (usually grown in the backyard). It is much tastier compared to broiler chickens and adds more flavor to the dish.
